name: Grand Jersey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: From the very first contact when we booked our trip, the staff at this super hotel went out of their way to make our stay special. My brother-in-law & I are both celebrating big birthdays this year and had a long weekend here with my husband and sister. We couldn't have picked a better hotel. Little touches like birthday cards and fruit bowls in the room, a card from the restaurant staff and free drinks when there was a minor problem with hot water that didn't even affect us really made our stay special. We'd certainly recommend the Grand Jersey.
reviews.title: A true 5 star stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a two night stay at the Grand and were not dissappointed at all.
reviews.title: First class service, from first class hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had booked this break through Groupon and to be honest had been totally dissappointed with the last two locations and services and were so glad and pleased that the Grand Jersey did not let us down.
reviews.title: Very lovely celebration stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They were kind enough to respond to emails before our trip just to satisfy my concerns, and then when we arrived the service was first class from stepping out of the cab right through to going up to our rooms. There was a lovely fruit basket and personal card wishing us good luck with our wedding in May, small things go a long way. I really am looking forward to clearing our diaries after the wedding and honeymoon to book another stay here.
reviews.title: Wonderful location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only points I would mention - and we have not scored them down for this was the hot water stopped working on Friday night, but they were really quick to pop a letter through all doors offering the use of the showers in the spa downstairs and a free drink per guest, but this did not affect us, but wanted to show you that they looked after their customers straight away, nice touch. Also if going out of season the main restaurants were closed for lunch on Saturday. You can eat in the Champagne lunch but not a large menu, but there are so many restaurants locally that you really are spoilt for choice, we ate in the Wildfire on Friday (really laid back diner) so much food and then Saturday night we ventured up to Little Italy restaurant in the next road to the hotel.
reviews.title: An excellent hotel in a superb location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: many years ago we came to jersey on a very limited budget and we often walked past the 5 star grand hotel and thought we wouldn't be able to afford to stay in such a posh hotel.
reviews.title: the grand tries to be 5 star .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: since then we have stayed in many hotels , some better than others , we have experienced 5 star and i'm afraid the grand jersey is a 4 star living off its luxury past .
reviews.title: Defiantly NOT 5*!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: you notice the small things that have been been changed to economise and they add up to not so luxurious experience .
reviews.title: A great location, but not quite the 5* experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the staff and rooms are very good but there are little things that could be upgraded like the toiletries and the breakfast ingredients . it's a good hotel all in all but not luxury.
reviews.title: Fantastic Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: there are some very good deals to be had here but you will get what you pay for .
reviews.title: Grand few days

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the staff we met were genuinely friendly, thoughtful and helpful - always trying to do their best for us. As other reviewers have said it can be noisy when they have a group in and there were groups in during our stay but the only noise that bothered us was when they were yelling their noisy goodbyes in the corridor! Our room overlooked the park and was large, light, clean and comfortable. The location is central and just minutes to the beach, promenade, cinema, shopping area and restaurants, bus station, ferry etc. Tassili, the Michelin star restaurant is superb - I had the vegetarian tasting menu at around £50 and it was excellent. The wines we had during our stay were quite exceptional. There is a comfortable lounge and a champagne bar. Breakfast was very good for carnivores. I only have one quibble and that is a common one with hotels outside South-East UK and that is the lack of understanding of herbal teas. I have been given green tea (which contains caffeine and is not herbal) and asked for Redbush tea to be given red berry tea - note to self take my own teabags! They did have Redbush in the Tassili restaurant so this could be extended to the breakfast room perhaps. I would highly recommend this hotel and we are really looking forward to our next visit there.
reviews.title: Genuinely helpful staff, central location, first class food & drink

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a luxury three night break at this hotel, supposedly in a Park View room, as a special treat to celebrate my husband’s 50th birthday.
reviews.title: Awful accommodation and customer care

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Although the food was nice both the accommodation and customer service were extremely poor.
reviews.title: Our three night break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despite our booking company's written booking confirmation clearly stating a Park View room we were not given one. Instead we were put in a truly miserable, gloomy, shabby and dirty room (room 208). Its only outlook was of a roof immediately in front of the window, air con ducts and other service installations. I had previously assumed that there must be some minimum standards for rooms in 5* hotels but it appears not.
reviews.title: nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A manager did eventually deign to speak to us but did not show the slightest sympathy for our situation, engage with our concerns or offer to do anything remotely constructive. Even a simple apology was never going to happen.
reviews.title: Friendliest staff I've ever come across - in this wee gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Came here for a weekend break and had the lowest grade room - classic interior. I knew therefore that there would be no view and was initially surprised that the windows were frosted over so there was no view of the outside world at all - maybe this was as well!
reviews.title: Overall a good experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was a reasonable size but seemed very 'busy' as they crammed in all the features. We had queen bed, 2 armchairs and coffee table, chest containing micro fridge, just big enough for the 2 complimentary (slightly odd tasting) bottles of water, refilled/replaced daily and the tea tray that had to be moved to the table under the large tv to access the power points. There was a wardrobe and a couple of drawers under the luggage table. So in reality everything you would need although there seemed to be very limited TV channels and somewhat patchy Wi-Fi..
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel not 5 *

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was comfortable and the linen excellent but the pillows had little substance and the duvet too much.
reviews.title: Don't bother with Afternoon Tea
Nice hotel but not 5 star
reviews.text: Contrary to one of the other reviews our bathroom was excellent and the bath towels a good size. Just remember not to get too close to the very hot towel rail. The temperature in the room was a bit of an issue but we were able to open the windows a little.

reviews.title: Don't expect a 5 star hotel!
reviews.text: Service overall was excellent, there seemed to be plenty of staff around and all the staff with whom we had contact spoke good English as their 2nd language.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: We were in a deluxe park view room, where we had a side view of the sea. Room was small but adequate, bathroom was crazy small not at all acceptable for a 5* hotel.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, but needs some attention

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Leisure facilities were very disappointing, pool was cold, nowhere to sit at all and hot tub would only really fit in 2 people unless you are very friendly with your fellow guests.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: Service was not great in lounge or at breakfast.
reviews.title: Luxurious break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Would not recommend this hotel, try somewhere else if you take my advice
reviews.title: Beautiful views from Hotel room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I am sitting reviewing this Hotel's Spa facilities. I went with my friend today for a fantastic Spa using Quids In vouchers. We arrived at 10am this morning, welcomed, given lovely soft dressing gowns and slippers and shown around the facilities. We changed in the well equipt dressing area, with hairdryers and spacious lockers. We had relaxed in a lovely waiting room, with tea and magazines. Our first treatment was a back, neck and shoulder, which was fantastic! our next thing was a lovely 2 course lunch again, served well and tasted great. Our next treatment was at 1-45pm where we has a mini facial, why, I asked myself had I not done this before!. I felt I had to recommend this Hotel and its facilities, as it was a pleasure. I did not feel rushed to leave and felt lovely and relaxed. Thank you to all the Staff for making it a lovely treat!
reviews.title: Spa day at The Grand

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I stayed here in January with a girlfriend and cannot rank them highly enough. Beautiful room, fantastic spa and wonderful bar. Eamon and his team cannot do enough to help.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel - fab service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is perfectly situation - only a five minute walk into the centre of town. Also a beautiful walk along the sea front promenade. Only 10 minutes by cab to St Brelades - we went to the Oyster Box for dinner which was lovely. The hotel recommended this to us and we loved it.
reviews.title: OK but not 5*

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have three kids and will definately return with them - great pool to keep them amused. They also do a baby sitting service if you want to come down to eat in one of the restaurants.
reviews.title: Recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Can't wait to go back!
reviews.title: Good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in February long weekend in February and on the whole had a pretty good stay. The hotel could do with some updating, but what is so good about the hotel are the staff. As previous reviews have stated, they do go out of their way to do things for you. We plan a return visit to the island and will probably book this hotel again.
reviews.title: Really Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012
reviews.text: Still here leaving today came for the weekend the staff where all great nothing to much trouble very friendly and helpfull, I felt the hotel could do with a bit of updating though I would come back first time in jersey a calm and beautiful island
reviews.title: On the whole pretty good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights and had a wonderful experience. The staff were exceptionally helpful and friendly and nothing was any trouble at all. From printing out boarding passes to leaving birthday cards for my husband and sister who were both celebrating significant birthdays. We were told that we would have park views, well we did but the balcony also had lovely sea views too. We were given complimentary drinks after there had apparently been an issue with the hot water one evening, we had not even noticed any problems. We ate at Tasili the Michelin starred restaurant and I would recommend anyone to eat here. The whole evening was wonderful, the experience, the staff were knowledgeable and friendly whilst being very efficient, the food was incredibly delicious and we enjoyed being able to watch some of the preparation on a big screen.
reviews.title: This is a fantastic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I used the gym and pool during the stay and had them to myself which I loved! My only disappointment was not being able to book a treatment at the spa, my own fault as I should have booked in advance rather than waiting until we had been there for a day!
reviews.title: Good Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are looking for a hotel in St. Helier I would highly recommend The Grand Jersey you will have a wonderful experience.
reviews.title: Spa Experience: Relaxation room let them down

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: I went to this hotel not knowing what to expect as it was my first time in jersey. it blew my expectations. The staff were are so friendly always have a smile and can never do enough for you. They make sure they go out of there way to keep you happy. The manager Eamonn was so pleasant and made sure your stay was wonderful. I did not meet one rude person. The hotel was stunning. Rooms were amazing, made you feel right at home. Beds were changed nearly everyday and we had all inclusive access to the tv. Watching films on demand was amazing. It meant you could relax after a long day. Which i've never experienced in any other hotel. We had full use of the spa and the treatments i had done was the best ive ever had. The use of the private cinema was outstanding!The location of the hotel was perfect right in the middle of everything from bars, shops, restaurants, activity's. Would deffinitly recommend this hotel to any genre of people. They cater for everything and anyone. They really do live up to there 5* ! i cannot wait to return!!
reviews.title: Best hotel experience I've ever had

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Grand Jersey for three nights recently for our honeymoon, using Pride of Britain vouchers that we were given as a wedding gift. It was wonderful. The hotel is located right across from the beach, and the view from our room was magical. The sea has a huge tide, so the view is constantly changing - and the view across to Elizabeth Castle was glorious. The hotel was perfect - clean, luxurious, friendly - utterly perfect. The buffet breakfast was delicious and extensive - something for everyone. We flew into Jersey from London, and took the regular bus from the airport to right outside the hotel - and picked it up from across the road to head back again. All super easy and straightforward. Fabulous hotel - would definitely stay there again if I get the chance!
reviews.title: Honeymoon Perfection!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013
reviews.text: Amazing hotel & top service from every single colleague at the hotel. Stayed for 6 nights & would defo recommend it, great food, great service, great rooms, great view, great spa, great everything!!!! Staff are so friendly, helpful, and are always smiling! It was a pleasure to have stayed here, will defo visit again!
reviews.title: It was a complete pleasure!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A fantastic 5 star hotel in a perfect location, right in front of Elizabeth Castle, the town and close by to Liberty Bus Station. The staff, facilities and atmosphere was great and the morning breakfast definitely set you up for a busy day.
reviews.title: A Great Grand Jersey Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A minor disappointment was the hotel bar/lounge was hired out for a private function which meant non-resident drunks were staggering around the hotel and loud part music was playing late into the night, which kind of ruined our relaxing stay. Regardless of this we enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Short break at GRAND in Jersey CI

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we have just returned from a weekend away at the jersey grand , I can not fault the staff as the service was excellent, the spa facilities was really relaxing with the steam room being a favourite.
reviews.title: lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from spending a lovely 5 day break in Jersey staying at the Grand. From the moment we arrived until we left the staff were exceptional, the guys parking the cars, reception staff ( special mention to Marianne who was lovely & so helpful), restaurant & bar staff always very attentive, in fact everyone we came into contact with always had a friendly smile and greeting for you. Our room was spacious and well equipped and lovely and clean, we overlooked the park but also had a wonderful view of St Aubins bay. Lovely large bathroom with tropical rain shower head, lovely comfy bed, just perfect. Any bad reviews regarding rooms have just been unfortunate I think because ours was first class. We could not find fault with anything within the hotel anywhere, so clean. We used the pool, steam room and sauna everyday and this was really nice, we liked the low lighting as it set the mood for relaxation. We ate in Tassili on our first night (see separate review), ate out a couple of nights and then in Victorias on our last night (delicious meal). Breakfast buffet was very good, a large selection on offer but you could always get other things if you asked. The island is so beautiful and we will definitely be returning and would stay at the Grand. A big thank you to all the staff.
reviews.title: FANTASTIC ALL THE WAY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at the grand hotel for a weekend in September for my husbands 40th with our two girls. There was a slight problem with the Internet booking but the staff bent over backwards to make up for this and we had an amazing stay. The staff were so friendly and couldn't do enough for us. The hotel is gorgeous and has a really luxurious and relaxing feel to it, rooms are lovely, great location, pool really nice, food so good.
reviews.title: Amazing, such a lovely hotel, staff were excellent, would definitely recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Would definitely go back again soon!
reviews.title: Good, but standards slipping

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a regular visitor we were disappointed with a number of elements of the grand this time. The spa decor is looking dated and the experience showers not working properly. The room (a deluxe seaview) had old windows that didn't close properly, a very noisy extractor fan / air con unit and generally looked tired.
reviews.title: Great Location - Excellent Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upgrading the windows, heating and ventilation of guest rooms and bathrooms would not only make ones stay more comfortable but would also reduce energy costs in the long term.
reviews.title: Very good hotel, excellent staff & breakfasts
Wonderful break
reviews.text: We aqrrived on a Saturday and was dissapointed to fing both restaurants fully booked out - not the hotel falt just an observation - maybe we should have been prompted at time of booking.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I stayed here for a girls' weekend and it was a perfect hotel for this. The service was excellent and the concierges very helpful. We had inland rooms, so no view at all, but they were very comfortable. The water was off for nearly twelve hours on the day we arrived but we were kept informed about what was happening and we were out for the most of the day, so it didn't affect us too much.
reviews.title: Great for a Relaxing Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We dined in Tassili's and I can't recommend this restaurant enough. The food and service were outstanding and I can highly recommend using the services of their sommelier who matched each dish to a glass of wine. The champagne bar has large windows with views out to sea so is great for relaxing as well as enjoying a drink or two. The breakfast was of a high standard with good variety of hot and cold options.
reviews.title: jersey weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only disappointment of our stay at this hotel was the spa. I had booked our treatments three weeks in advance and they had made mistakes with the bookings, so all three of us had reduced treatments. The staff member who dealt with us over this definitely lacked some polish in her customer service skills and we had to come up with the solution ourselves. The jacuzzi was cold so we didn't have the full experience. The massage I had was very good but didn't quite make up for the rest of the spa experience.
reviews.title: Afternoon Tea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is close to the town centre and the street around the corner has a large range of good value restaurants. I would definitely stay here again on a trip to Jersey.
reviews.title: Spa is a treat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012
reviews.text: went for a weekend and enjoyed the experience the room was very nice although the first room we were given was smaller and noisy so we asked to move and it was no problem to the staff
reviews.title: Great hotel

description: Grand Jersey is the island’s stylish, sophisticated hotel and spa, presenting guests an exceptional experience. It offers the ultimate in comfort and glamour, through a blend of sophisticated restaurants, the exclusive, atmospheric Champagne Lounge and the luxurious, award winning Spa. Grand Jersey also features the innovative Park Suites – a dedicated business centre with private cinema, meeting rooms and flexible events spaces. Whether you’re visiting Jersey for a short break, summer holiday or business, you are assured of a wonderful stay. Grand Jersey is committed to the highest standards of service and excellence which is why the hotel is one of only two on the island to be awarded five stars.
